com.autonomy.aci.client.util

Class EncryptionCodecUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.autonomy.aci.client.util.EncryptionCodecUtils

  • public class EncryptionCodecUtils
extends Object
    This is a utility class that encrypts and decrypts String objects, it main function is to hide the required conversions between strings and byte arrays.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EncryptionCodecUtils()

      Encrypt the given string with the supplied codec and use the supplied charset name for any string/byte conversions.

      Returns the thread safe singleton instance of this class.

      Encodes the string into a sequence of bytes using the named charset, storing the result into a new byte array.
      String toString(byte[] bytes, String charsetName)
      Constructs a new String by decoding the specified array of bytes using the specified charset.

        public static EncryptionCodecUtils getInstance()

        Returns:

      • encrypt

        public String encrypt(EncryptionCodec codec,
             String string,
             String charsetName)
               throws EncryptionCodecException
        Encrypt the given string with the supplied codec and use the supplied charset name for any string/byte conversions.
        Parameters:
        codec - The EncryptionCodec to use
        string - The input to encrypt
        charsetName - The name of charset to use for string and byte array conversion
        Returns:
        The encrypted input
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - if something went wrong during either the conversion of encrypting

      • decrypt

        public String decrypt(EncryptionCodec codec,
             String string,
             String charsetName)
               throws EncryptionCodecException
        Decrypt the given string with the supplied codec and use the supplied charset name for any string/byte conversions.
        Parameters:
        codec - The EncryptionCodec to use
        string - The input to decrypt
        charsetName - The name of charset to use for string and byte array conversion
        Returns:
        The decrypted input
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - if something went wrong during either the conversion of decrypting.

      • toString

        public String toString(byte[] bytes,
              String charsetName)
                throws EncryptionCodecException
        Constructs a new String by decoding the specified array of bytes using the specified charset. The length of the new String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to the length of the byte array.

        The behavior of this method when the given bytes are not valid in the given charset is unspecified. The CharsetDecoder class should be used when more control over the decoding process is required.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to be decoded into characters
        charsetName - the name of a supported charset
        Returns:
        A string representation of the bytes argument
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - If the named charset is not supported
        NullPointerException - If either bytes or charsetName is null

      • toBytes

        public byte[] toBytes(String string,
             String charsetName)
               throws EncryptionCodecException
        Encodes the string into a sequence of bytes using the named charset, storing the result into a new byte array.

        The behavior of this method when this string cannot be encoded in the given charset is unspecified. The CharsetEncoder class should be used when more control over the encoding process is required.

        Parameters:
        string - The String to convert to a byte array.
        charsetName - The name of a supported charset
        Returns:
        The resultant byte array
        Throws:
        EncryptionCodecException - If the named charset is not supported
        NullPointerException - if either string or charsetName is null
